website_summaries.verdict: A stellar tool with a great range of options and phenomenal accuracy. The best on the market.

customer_reviews.title: Work horse
customer_reviews.text: I have owned three of these saws. They can withstand some serious work and are well built. They cut true and are easy to adjust. They are a bit heavy and cumbersome but what would you expect with a 16" straight cut capacity saw. Fork out the $ and get the rolling stand you'll be glad you did. This saw does not have the laser,but any carpenter worth his sawdust doesn't need a laser to cut accurately. Save a couple hundred $ and buy this saw the "779" not the 780. Use the extra money to buy the rolling stand. Now get back to work!
customer_reviews.author: saywhat?

customer_reviews.title: Great saw but it has a minor problem
customer_reviews.text: Love the saw. It works great. Only problem is that the housing underneath the kerf plate has an elevated part that causes the saw to bottom out if you don't use the depth stop. I compared mine to the 780 on display at home depot and theirs has a metal housing with no elevated piece. Also had DeWalt send me a replacement part and it's identical to the one I already have. So I plan on just using the depth stop for now and maybe modifying the housing myself in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Safety
customer_reviews.text: I've been in carpentry for over 30 years. Best saw for the money.
customer_reviews.author: richard cave

customer_reviews.title: Today was it's first day and was a great proving ground for the saw with a big project ...
customer_reviews.text: I will continue to update this rating and review with useage. Today was it's first day and was a great proving ground for the saw with a big project I'm working on. Square out of box, with 32T blade, cut through 4×4, 2×12 like a hot knife through butter (as it should), quiet, powerful, and maybe my saw is different but super smooth sliding action, sawdust catcher worked as advertised! (Pleasantly surprised about that) It worked much better than my previous Makita. Very happy with what I got. Especially for the this price, this is a quality saw that you'll be happy you got.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Smith

customer_reviews.title: Cuts excellently!
customer_reviews.text: Cuts very well. I added this miter saw to my new collection of dewalt tools to my workshop. I did a lot of research on finding this best one for me. I love dewalt products and tools and this seemed like the best bang for my buck. Cuts very well and has the 12inch blade. Home Depot was selling the 10 inch for the same price so you’re getting a good deal here with the larger blade. I’d buy 1000 x again.
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price...cheap made product!
customer_reviews.text: I have been in construction as a business owner now for 30 years....This saw lasted only 3 weeks in our cabinet shop.The arbor and bearings have failed already showing as though the blade was warped....well the blade is fine.Do not buy This cheaply made name brand product.The name is not what it use to be!
customer_reviews.author: Sherril McGuire

customer_reviews.title: Best saw for the price
customer_reviews.text: What’s not to like? The most efficient saw for the $. HANDS DOWN Just bought another after my old one died Same saw pretty much I forgot my original purchase date but it was at least 15 years ago, working as a trim carpenter.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Johns Const. Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Warped blade & NO service!
customer_reviews.text: The blade warped my first day using it cutting one inch decking. Dewalt said they had never heard of such a thing. Waited 4 days for the replacement blade. It never arrived! Done with Dewalt!
customer_reviews.author: Paul H. Ayers

customer_reviews.title: Kinda crappy chop box.
customer_reviews.text: This saw starts really loud and hard. Works fine. Though. But I’m a little disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Reanna B.

customer_reviews.title: Great saw at a good price!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a couple saws over the years and this is my favorite one for sure! It does have one idiosyncrasy I find very annoying though - - - If you make a cut and push the saw arm down all the way, it will lock in the down position and you have to reach around to unlock it again. Not sure why Dewalt designed it that way - annoying - but not a deal breaker for an otherwise great saw!
customer_reviews.author: aztriman

customer_reviews.title: Blade hits the kerf plate. Definite manufacturing default.
customer_reviews.text: Blade is offset to the left. Hits he kerf plate on a zero bevel cut. Returning as defective. I called Dewalt and they weren’t too interested and slightly rude. Told me to return it and hope for a better one next time. Got a replacement and the second saw is misaligned to. Added a picture of it. Ridiculous. Bosch time.
customer_reviews.author: Iniray L.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Saw
customer_reviews.text: After about 15 years, we wore out our previous Dewalt miter saw and purchased this one as the replacement, because it's the same model. It has a couple of improvements over the old saw, but overall appears to be the same quality saw. The material hold down clamp that it comes with is pretty cheesy because it can get in the way with the saw coming down if used on the right side of the saw, so we don't use it.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware !
customer_reviews.text: Bought this saw over 2 years ago for my woodshop but never had a chance to use it due to health issues. (8 brain surgeries) Now that I'm capable to use my machines I set out to make a flag shadow box for a friend. When I cut the 45's on this saw I noticed that they were not exactly straight. Upon investigation I found that the auxiliary fences are out of square with no way to adjust it. Everything thing else is adjusted fine on the saw. So I have an expensive saw to rough cut to length.
customer_reviews.author: Clay R Burton

customer_reviews.title: Nice Saw
customer_reviews.text: I needed to write this to correct a post that another person wrote about the clip that holds the say down . A person wrote that the clip always locks when they made a cut and pushed the saw head all the way down. The guy said it was a bad design and annoying to release the lock after every cut.. I bought the saw and the first thing i noticed is if you pull the release knob out turn it either way and let it go it will stay that way and not lock after every cut. Common sense is amazing eh!
customer_reviews.author: Its Marvelous!

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Wow. Wow A purchase I wish I'd made yrs ago. I'm using a 44t blade vs the stock, but the whole package is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: allonespeed

customer_reviews.title: DWS779 Sliding Compound Miter Saw
customer_reviews.text: Down side: Amazon lowered price by $20 before I even received my saw ordered a week ago. Not good. Good that it set up easily and surprisingly needed NO adjustment anywhere. I was surprised by the power difference from my older, smaller miter saw. The handle rises at startup, not soft at all. It cuts confidently and smoothly. I did replace the blade that came w/ the saw with a better one (carbide and more teeth) Frankly I do not miss the laser cut guide on the old saw. Guess I always trusted eyeball cut placement (worked well for years).
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy this thang
customer_reviews.text: Cuts through 2x4 and 4x4 with no issue. Bought to use for one job around the house, next thing I knew I was cutting wood like it was my damn job. I made a bench for my mom and a chest for my sister just because I just wanted to keep using and listening to the blade run like a banshee screaming for a fresh kill. This saw may make you addicted to wood working, be very careful young ones.
customer_reviews.author: Bryson Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Worst tool Dewalt has ever made
customer_reviews.text: Dust collection is a joke. It absolutely doesn’t work when hooked up to a shop vac or dust collector. The floppy flaps close. Biggest disappointment of any Dewalt tool. The blade chips out the bottom rear of every cut when set in locked chop saw mode. The depth stop is not easily adjustable and you have to take it off completely to lock the saw closed. The extension arms for the sides do not line up. Could not install them. And the molded plastic handle/trigger do not align right and poke your palm with a sharp corner every time you use it. Very poorly designed and performs horrible. Gotten better results from an $80 no name saw from Harbor Freight.
customer_reviews.author: Sci-fi Junky

customer_reviews.title: DEWALT QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: Solid quality saw! I purchased this one to replace my 12 inch dual bevel slide miter saw as it took up to much space in my small shop. WHen used in the 90 degree cut position it only takes up about 26 inchs, where my dual slide took up 44 inches. This one has the same solid quality and is smooth, accurate and precise in operation. I almost never used the dual miter feature on the other saw anyway !
customer_reviews.author: DannyH

customer_reviews.title: Saw draws a lot of power and is larger than is shown on the web site.
customer_reviews.text: I do not like that with the sliders this machine is much bigger than I thought it would be. I would have sent it back but the box and the stuffing were all ruined unpacking the saw. I now have to hire an electrician as the saw draws so much electricity I can't use it with just my lights on as it kicks off the circuit breaker. Not your fault but I think that this will just be put into a corner in the garage and I will go to Lowes and purchase one that I can use.
customer_reviews.author: Larry H.

customer_reviews.title: Used it twice.  Then the blade stopped spinning.
customer_reviews.text: Light duty homeowner used this Dewalt Mitre saw for simple stuff like making frames. Nothing heavy duty, extremely light. Second time using it today since my purchase in April 2020. Blade stopped spinning, as though it became disconnected to the motor somehow. Dewalt is no help. They just pointed me to a service center. Of course they're closed till further notice due to the virus issue, so I'm outta luck. And 6 days out from when Amazon will take returns. Can't recommend this unit. Sad because I thought I was buying something decent. Apparently not.
customer_reviews.author: ZoesDad

customer_reviews.title: Quality Control not up to par.
customer_reviews.text: Saw wobbles bad on flat surfaces. Dewalt gotta up there game. I bought 2 of these and both had same issue.
customer_reviews.author: justin k.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Excellent saw for beginning carpentry, woodworking and DIY projects. Set up took just minutes and I paired it with a portable saw stand from Dewalt so I would be working at a waist high level...no more cutting on the ground with a hand held circular saw!
customer_reviews.author: Tony Franzetti

customer_reviews.title: Smooth cut
customer_reviews.text: Precision cuts and unparalleled performance. I use it for building bookshelves and doing crown molding around the house. Will be doing hardwood flooring later this year and this will make the install go smooth as long as my measurements are right. I paired this up with a diablo blade and couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Rice

customer_reviews.title: Solid miter station saw
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my larger DWS780 with the DWS715, and have found it to be a very solid trade. The -715 was dead on accurate from the factory, light weight (relative to the -780!), and easy to get setup. I replaced the blade immediately and made a zero clearance insert for quick upgrades. Only gripe is the material hold down clamp is so inferior compared to that of the -780; however, as it's being used in a miter station and I rarely used the hold down clamp anyway, this is a "nit" of a gripe. Especially for the discounted price (Christmas special pricing of $199), the DWS715 was an outstanding purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Awesome saw for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awesome saw for the money! My old Makita finally died and needed something to replace it. This saw is accurate and the included blade does the job well! I see this lasting a long time, I'm a Milwaukee guy typically but you can beat dewalts corded tools! I would absolutely buy again. I made 2 work benches over the weekend, with the gret accuracy of the saw I had all the wood cut quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with the saws performance.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great piece of machinery. Out of the box little or no adjustment needed, very accurate.HOWEVER if you plan to use a dust collection system you will have to make a simple mod to the stock dust boot supplied. I took the dust tube out and drilled and tapped locations for machine screws to attach a more substantial rubber boot. Absolutely works great. (The original boot will get sucked into the dust pipe rendering it useless)
customer_reviews.author: Rafe

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working during first use.
customer_reviews.text: Used once, saw will turn on, blade will not rotate. Called manufacturer and stayed on hold for over an hour and still no reply.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Gove

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Great saw at a great price. Same saw at Lowe’s is $299
customer_reviews.author: john mcintyre

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for the most part.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, a great saw for both the DIYer and professionals that are not using the slide functionality on a frequent basis. The saw is well built, and the positive locks seem accurate and rock solid. The slide does seem a little sticky as some other reviews suggest; I don't use the feature very often, so I'm not ready to give up on an otherwise great saw because of that. Other features are well designed and make blade change and accurate cutting fast and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Adam J. McKee

customer_reviews.title: Misaligned blade!!!
customer_reviews.text: Dewalt dsw 780 in online very poor quality. 1- Misalignment blade. Work with small job is ok but couldn’t do big job, the blade will hit the kerf plate at 45 degree on lhe left and right. 2- Missing XPS label. If you guy like to get the DWS 780 with 5***** go and buy it in the Home Depot store and Lowe’s too. You get what you pay!
customer_reviews.author: Sonny N.

customer_reviews.title: Durable product, compact, not that noisy, cut everything
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband as a christmas present. He loves it. He cuts anything on it wood, rhohide bone for dogs etc. It's compact and fits in the corner of the workshop. It's easy to use. And apperantly it motivates husbands to work on lots of projects. Mine just finished storage compartment in the garage and started to work on the laundry room. So I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Haskins

customer_reviews.title: Problem with the material hold down accessory (maybe)
customer_reviews.text: Besides sawing into the backstop during an angle cut its worked great very precise and sturdy. My issue with it is customer service and the possibility they built the hold down wrong. When I go to install it ..it only would hold down material BEHIND the backstop. It looks to me they machined the part 180 off. But I only looked this for a few mins and just tossed it to the side. I called customer service for this and the stand I bought and it was a forever-wait situation and my calls were dropped while on hold and when being transferred. Once I actually talked to someone they were less than useless.
customer_reviews.author: yawn

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: The saw was calibrated right out of the box. The saw has ample power for all jobs. Miter lock works perfectly with no adjustment needed. Dust collection is accomplished with an adapter for your favorite shop vac. The saw is heavy but when placed on a portable stand, any job is a breeze. I highly recommend this saw for anyone looking.
customer_reviews.author: jj1781

customer_reviews.title: Blade lock
customer_reviews.text: Responding to the blade lock issue. If you turn the lock 1/2 turn it will stay unlocked.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda G.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome saw!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool! Awesome price! This is the exact same tool as the highest quality one but without the laser guide. I never liked/trusted the laser anyway so bonus round on getting this for $200 less.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding quality, but somewhat over-rated value.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely nice quality saw, but you’re paying so much more for the DeWalt name than other comparable mitre saws on the market. I also bought a TackLife mitre saw and posted a positive review for it’s excellent value for the $$. You really can’t go wrong with this DeWalt — aside from spending roughly $100 more than you need to for a similar saw.
customer_reviews.author: Tony's Reviews

customer_reviews.title: My favorite tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was replacing my deck and needed to cut a LOT of lumber. Set it up outdoors on a table and went to work. The saw is terrific. It cuts through 2x4's, 5/4x6's and 4x4's like they were butter. Easy to adjust the cutting angle. Good safety features, I didn't come even close to injuring myself during the project. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff P

customer_reviews.title: Great saw but....
customer_reviews.text: DeWalt is all you need to know.... well made, a real workhorse but I gave it 4 stars because of the inadequate dust collection system. It uases an odd size fitting for the collection bag which fills to quickly as it is inadequatly sized. The odd size fitting does not have a vaccuum adapter that will fit it and when I did finally tape my shop vac it caused the rubber flanges to collapse making it useless. DeWalt cut corners on this aspect and the saw produces a lot of saw dust....
customer_reviews.author: Marvin L. Benoit

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing. Well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Where have you been all my life? This thing is amazing. Well worth the price. I bought this along with the miter stand (the one with wheels from dewalt) and it’s a wonderful combination. Highly recommended. The only thing I found that I didn’t like was the blade. Some reviewers claimed it came with a 60t blade but mine arrived with a 32t blade. I upgraded the blade to a 12” Freud 72t.
customer_reviews.author: JSully

customer_reviews.title: Great buy. Excellent quality and accuracy....
customer_reviews.text: The is a great saw for the money. DeWalt has a rep for being high quality and it is. Not the highest but definitely high. They didn't miss anything in the design of this saw. (I suppose I could have bought one that shoots laser beam at the cut but isn't that what a pencil's for?) I downgraded one star because it's made overseas (blade was made in China and the saw was made in Taiwan.) I just wish these kinds of tools were once again made by American. And yes, I'd be happy to pay a little more.
customer_reviews.author: The Flylooper

customer_reviews.title: Really Nice Saw
customer_reviews.text: I really like this saw. Square out of the box. It is a beast. My third miter saw. It is far superior to my old Makita and Harbor Freight. Made in Taiwan and seems to be precision cast and machined and great quality. Nice finish. Had to remove the guard to install the thicker Frued 100 tooth blade. Changing blades is a little bit of a pain but will not need to do this often. Stock Dewalt blade is a little rough for finish work. Really nice saw
customer_reviews.author: happy

customer_reviews.title: This monster works well
customer_reviews.text: This is not a mamby pamby unit. I traded in an 8 pound Riyobi chop saw for this 50+ pound behemoth. It is a monster and has more controls and levers than most people want, including me. However, it cuts perfectly and once I got used to the gadgets, it is now my cutting tool of choice. It is 95% assembled coming out of the box so no need for an engineer. It is heavy and a good stand stand is a must. Once this guy gets cranking, keep the load of lumber flowing. It is a workhorse. I will never go back to a smaller unit.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: great saw
customer_reviews.text: I thought I needed a sliding saw but for the money thought I would give this saw a try instead. Big blade makes for big cuts. Don't need a sliding saw for the around the house stuff I do. Great saw. Accurate. Powerful. No laser but you really don't need it if you know what you are doing.
customer_reviews.author: James R Bates

customer_reviews.title: MISSING PARTS!!!
customer_reviews.text: Missing parts. Well shucks folks. My luck has been good with refurbished products so far but seems to have run out somewhat. This saw showed up missing parts and with the wrong adjustment wrench. Sure it still cuts and sure the mechanism is still sweet, but the bitter taste of having to go part hunting takes a lot of the ‘hooray’ out of this tool purchase. To make matters worse I left it in the box (because I was busy sanding floors and painting walls) for so long returns aren’t a option. So maybe pay full pop and get the saw you wanted with all the doodads that are supposed to be there.
customer_reviews.author: Sketchbook

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic saw. Those who remark that it's dead-on out of the box crack me up. What matters is how easy it is to dial in, not whether it's accurate from the factory. This saw is so easy to true up with its included wrench, it makes accuracy a breeze. I still prefer a laser to the XPS light, but it probably will just take me getting used to it. The box was delivered with a big gash in the side (forklift), but the saw was fine.
customer_reviews.author: K. J. Bessenbacher

customer_reviews.title: Best saw on market!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this saw, and immediately upgraded with light kit to make it a 780. First cut was dead on the money, and smooth. Turned saw to 45 degrees and cut perfect miters. I replaced a Craftsman 12 in sliding miter with this saw and man, you get what you pay for here. Only con would be dust collection, like mentioned in posts. Had to purchase the click on adapter to straight dust collection pipe. CA glued dust collection to the adapter and hooked up to my separation unit. Works great, minimal residual dust when vacuum is on. Also, this saw needs room to operate so plan accordingly. No regrets here, VERY happy with the saw.
customer_reviews.author: P. Bates

customer_reviews.title: Great product helping me to complete lots of projects this spring/summer
customer_reviews.text: I have been replacing some cheaper tools with Dewalt brand tools. The difference is night and day and I could seriously kick myself for my earlier decisions. When I bought and used my first saw I thought “good enough.” I was very wrong. This saw is amazing. I get accurate cuts (previous saw left me to do a lot or re-work) and when I used the saw recently to cut some 4x4s, this saw went cleanly through without any issue or struggle. Worth every dollar.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this saw for 5 years now and use it quite often; it is one of my favorite power tools. I have installed Brazilian Cherry hardwood in my home and this saw with a Dewalt 100 tooth blade cut through that wood with ease. Amazon and the big box stores usually sells these for the same price (I bought mine through Amazon before the sales tax implementation, so it was a good deal for that reason). Once a year for several weeks, Dewalt will run a promotion for this saw and the heavy duty stand (DWX723) for $599 together, so unless your are in an immediate need for the saw, wait until then to save $200.
customer_reviews.author: traveler

customer_reviews.title: After truing, it's a great, accurate saw.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the saw. I bought it to trim the interior of my house. Out of the box, the saw I received was not square in either plane. Spend about an hour truing the saw before jumping into your first project. For interior trim, the stock blade will not be the best option, however, for general framing, it will work great. I changed the stock blade for the 96T. Although a little dim in the brightest daylight, the aiming light is a great help. Works well and the controls are intuitive and well placed.
customer_reviews.author: Stevi_Montana

customer_reviews.title: DIY’er approved
customer_reviews.text: I am a non-pro diy’er and love this saw! My sister in law has a 10 inch but I opted for the bigger one so I could cut an entire piece of 6” shiplap all the way across without having to turn it over to get the other end. That alone was worth it to me. Saves a lot of time! I love that I can angle it too. Framed a bathroom mirror with the angled cuts and it came out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Angie W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: Of course DEWALT makes a great Miter saw as anyone who ever purchased one can attest. This one being the 12" size is not one to be considered as portable and therefore should be mounted to a great stand like the BOCH gravity or a more permanent bench. I am very happy with my purchase and would recommend it to anyone looking for a quality miter saw.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a beast!
customer_reviews.text: As others have said it's very very heavy. I can't move it without my hubby so I purchased the stand which makes it pretty easy. It works great and I have cut quite a lot of lumber on our house remodel. I'm really glad we went with this one. It'a easily 3 times the weight of our old one that I could haul around on my own. I love the functions and believe it or not it's really quiet compared to our old one. That shocked me a little because I was used to a really loud machine for the last 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: TamiP

customer_reviews.title: I saw it and with it I saw
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Others have mentioned the included blade isn’t great and I agree, but it’s been fine for what I’ve been working on. I haven’t needed anything better yet. I’ve been really pleased with the saw, and the few projects I’ve used it for thus far have turned out great. I can’t speak for a professional, but if you’re a harebrained Harry homeowner handyman like me you can’t go wrong with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Saw, Great Price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw to replace a 30 year old DeWalt miter saw. I needed to miter cut some 10 inch boards. It worked good out of the box. No adjustments required. I do like the softer start of the blade as compared to my old one. It is quite a bit heavier than my old saw. It is a handful, but the handles really help to lift the saw. This version doesn’t have the light shadow or laser of the more expensive model. I haven’t needed it in 30 years so the extra money didn’t seem worth it to me.
customer_reviews.author: D. Graf

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my 30+ year old Craftsman miter saw. This saw is accurate and the angle adjustments are easy to make with detents at all the most used angles and locks at all angles with the lock down screw. The handle and switch location is much more comfortable than some of the others on the market that I researched. All this at a great price too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Know which DWS779 you’re buying. Type 21 or 22
customer_reviews.text: 8/2020 - I received this saw and it is type 22 which removes some features from the previous types. If you’re looking for the side bevel stops / pawls, this saw does not have them. Not all DWS779’s are the same. Instead of adding features for newer types, DeWalt does cost down and deletes features. Otherwise, it’s a great saw and good value.
customer_reviews.author: DWS779 type 22

customer_reviews.title: Great deal from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: My first miter saw. Great deal from Amazon. Set it up and it runs great. Not very noisy in my opinion... I've heard much, much worse from table saws and planers. Very well packaged, with no damage at all. Setup was easy... took about 14 minutes after cutting the tape on the box before I made my first cut... REAL NICE SAW!!! Well aligned out of the box. Very steady and clean cuts, no wobble in the arms, easy to slide back and forth, and no disturbing vibrations. Have the saw mounted on a DeWalt miter saw stand.
customer_reviews.author: B. Fuller

customer_reviews.title: JUNK--DON'T BUY
customer_reviews.text: This is the third DWS780 saw that I bought and had to return. The problem is when it is in a 45-degree miter it is no longer plumb to the table. Impossible to get an accurate cut. If you buy this saw that would be the first thing I would check. After you square it out of course.
customer_reviews.author: John Cali

customer_reviews.title: Cracked frame
customer_reviews.text: Frame cracked - backside of the fence - see attached pictures. Waiting for replacement.
customer_reviews.author: chubbybignutts

customer_reviews.title: read this before the negative reviews.
customer_reviews.text: Anyone who says anything negative or “I can’t put it together” shouldn’t have purchased it in the first place. There is no assemble. There are optional mounts you can add if you buy the table for it. You don’t need them. Also, my house was built in 1900 and I have 15 amp breakers. Not one popped while using inside the house. So it is 15 amps. If you’re popping breakers you have electrical problems
customer_reviews.author: Barnald Obamump

customer_reviews.title: Good Saw for a modest price
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Used it to put quarter-round on my back porch and crown up on my front porch ceiling. Accuracy is good. Easy to use. Had a shop vac hooked up to the dust port and it kept things clean. Don't use it enough to give it a professional grade review, but for a homeowner it'll definitely do the job. Good saw for the modest price.
customer_reviews.author: BillyDoc

customer_reviews.title: Best compound slider I have used
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw with the DeWalt stand. Very happy with it. Rugged, suitable for commercial use. My only beef is that a quick release to get it on and off the stand would have been nice. Maybe that's more of an issue for the stand than the saw. As far as cutting goes, this tool in my opinion is the best in class.
customer_reviews.author: Andy G

customer_reviews.title: Previous owner markings? I bought this new.
customer_reviews.text: Cleaned the tool today and noticed letters and marks on the tool near the slide stop. I purchased this brand new. Why would there be markings on a brand new tool, as if there was a previous owner? Tool has been great, though, but I paid for new. Why is my tool written on?
customer_reviews.author: L. Woods

customer_reviews.title: Excellent saw, worth paying for more saw.  Don't be cheap thinking you get equal value.
customer_reviews.text: I am a home gamer and needed a new saw to replace a Crapsman I bought 3 or 4 years ago for a little less than half the price of this saw. What a mistake...now I know. This DeWalt saw is a truly professional tool that has seen a lot of use already. I did swap out the blade before using, since the blade it came with was not for fine carpentry, which boggles my mind. Maybe they could offer the saw at two price points, depending on the chosen blade, and give a discount for buying the blade with the saw.
customer_reviews.author: BD in Jacksonville

customer_reviews.title: A fine machine, very versatile
customer_reviews.text: A fine machine, very versatile. CAUTION: blade should be lowered into the kerf in the bed just enough to make the cut. The flexibility of this machine allows you to dip it in a few inches, but if you're cross cutting a small piece of wood with the blade deep in the kerf the teeth will meet the wood traveling up instead of across the grain. This will likely fling the wood upwards unless it's clamped down. Obvious, right? But not to this amateur dodo!!
customer_reviews.author: richard elrauch

customer_reviews.title: Good overall, but some issues to beware of
customer_reviews.text: Pros I like that it has a depth stop It's much more quiet than my old one It has great range and you can cut wide pieces Accurate right out of the box Steel detent plate is good Cons Very long, so you need a huge open space behind it If you don't set the depth stop it allows the blade to cut the plastic detent adjuster - dumb dumb design there Base extension arms are a big pain to install Even if you lock the slide when you move it it's still slides out and pisses you off
customer_reviews.author: User One

customer_reviews.title: SO HAPPY!
customer_reviews.text: I borrowed a smaller, non-sliding saw for one project and we used it so much I wanted to buy one. This is fantastic! I don't have a permanent place for it yet (need to get that she-shed built first) but it isn't too cumbersome to move in and out of the garage and the fact that it slides helps tremendously.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Blade frozen within 15 minutes of use. NO support from DeWalt
customer_reviews.text: I usually love DeWalt tools - I have quite a collection. I cut just a couple pieces of wood - 1" boards and then the blade just froze up and would not turn. There's nothing stuck in the blade it's like it slammed its own brakes on and won't let go. The blade won't spin at all. Sending it back. So bummed out. Its Saturday so there's no support and the documentation is terrible so it's going back. My last cheap Craftsman lasted 25 years. I'm getting another cheap chopsaw from home depot tomorrow - Maybe all the fancy features on this one is what hurt the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. C.

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt rules...
customer_reviews.text: Okay, for past decades I have avoided Dewalt because of the price. I finally jumped on the bandwagon when this 12" miter saw went on sale. Wow, wish I had just bought Dewalt all along. Pretty amazing line of tools. This saw is high quality all around, and has some features that make it stand out even more. E.g., actual cut-out's on the degree of rotation plate, a sliding fence on the left side, etc. I have bought name brands in past years (not the low-end cheap stuff), but they just don't compare....
customer_reviews.author: Huffy

customer_reviews.title: Decent Saw but Discontinued and Inspect It
customer_reviews.text: I've just received the saw, and have tried a few cuts. This is a discontinued item that was created as a special buy for store shelves. It came with a stress fracture on the body but it shouldn't impact performance. It comes with a 90 no questions warranty so I'll put that to the test. It needed a few minor adjustments to zero out but nothing major. It's not light and works best as a shop saw that's mounted. I did as the other reviews suggested and used the depth stop to avoid slicing the small piece beneath the work area.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel384

customer_reviews.title: this is a great saw.
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Solid. Accurate of of the box Large capacity Powerful CONS Heavy Its BIG, you may want a dedicated space for this. I do. weird dust collection port that adds even more inches to the depth of workspace needed. ( I built a 36" deep table for my station thats up against a wall. ) the extensions wings add only a few inches.i've found them rather useless. this is a saw for a mitre station. I use it at least every week, some for work, some for home projects. its a beast and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy is what it is all about
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy cheap imitations!! My Dewalt has been worth every penny I spent. I bought another saw first from a national discount freight store and it worked for your everyday cuts, but when it came to precision cuts, I got what I paid for, heartache and torture. The only thing I wish this saw had was a laser guide, but other than that, I love it!! I don’t regret the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: richfarns

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 2 weeks then broke (SINCE BEEN REPLACED)
customer_reviews.text: Literally broke after about 2 weeks and maybe only a handful of uses. Motor sounds ridiculously loud and the blade won't break after I shut it off now. Won't even cut through wood without stopping either. Also the tool for removing the blade would not fit the screws for some reason, no matter how hard I tried. They were quick to replace it with the same model which is working fine thus far. Also the tool now fits to remove the blade.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Koelsch

customer_reviews.title: Awesome saw
customer_reviews.text: This thing cuts through wood like a hot knife in butter. Out of the box, it needed some very slight adjustments for accuracy. What would I change? 1 - make the dust tube on the back some standard size for dust collectors. NONE of my standard adapters fit snugly. 2- Add a laser guide. I added this cheap aftermarket guide. It works fine, but the saw has to be spinning to see it -  Other than that, it's a fantastic saw. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: JLDizzy

customer_reviews.title: Compound Miter Saw
customer_reviews.text: I am a back yard woodworker that likes to make crafts and rustic furniture. I replaced my 25 year old DeWalt Miter Saw (still worked great( with this DeWalt Compound Sliding Miter Saw with XPS. The crosscut positioning system is definite plus making aligning cuts much faster and more precise. The sliding portion has improved versatility in the size of cross cuts I am able to make significantly reducing setup time on some project. Great saw and would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Phil F.

customer_reviews.title: greatsaw
customer_reviews.text: In doing a landscaping project at my home, I found it necessary to be able to cut treated 4"x6" lumber. This saw worked great for this job.
customer_reviews.author: David Phenes

customer_reviews.title: Buy one!! You won't regret it!!
customer_reviews.text: We are doing some remodeling that requires a lot of crown and other moldings. My wife and son decided I need an upgrade from my 20 year old Porter Cable miter saw. This new saw is great!! Between the LED light that lays down a shadow line where the blade will cut to 50/60 degree left/right AND the blade tilts both left and right (old PC saw only swung one direction). This saw has a load of great features. As I said in title, if you are shopping for a new miter saw, get this one, you won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: J. F. Somerville

customer_reviews.title: My new DEWALT 12-Inch Sliding Compound Miter Saw, Double Bevel
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a saw that would be the great grandfather to this one for at least 15 years. It never wore out and did all the work we needed. It was stolen out of my workshop; somebody had a great find but probably sold it for 1/10th of its worth. The new one is nice and shiny, with a few nice updated features. My sons, grandsons and I love it! I believe It cost about the same as the one that was stolen. If you need a 12-Inch Sliding Compound Miter Saw with Double Bevel, this is the one you should buy!
customer_reviews.author: Mad Dog

customer_reviews.title: Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Could not pass the 12" up when I saw the price. Have had a 10" for years. Only difference I see is that Dewalt skimped on the chord length. About 5'6" for the 12" compared to 8'6" on my 10" saw. Don't know if that is UL rule or not. Way too short. Easy set up.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cox Jr.

customer_reviews.title: This miter saw is just a beast...
customer_reviews.text: I had been researching all kinds of dual bevel sliding miter saws for a while always coming back to this one. I'm glad I made the purchase. There is no soft start to be ready for the saw to jump on you when you start it but once operating its smooth as can be and the level of accuracy is many times better than the saw it replaced. I purchased this for the accuracy. I do a lot of high end finish trim and this is what I needed to dial in my cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Holtman

customer_reviews.title: Who Needs Lasers Or LED’s?!
customer_reviews.text: Got it for a GREAT price. At the time it was only $349. Did I need it? No, but for that price.... The replacement is $599! This model does NOT come with any fancy laser or LED line cut markers. But five minutes of practice and you’re fine. Check twice, cut once. Right? Does NOT come with crown stops, so order those when you buy if you plan on doing crown. I also bought a Diablo 100 tooth blade and it cuts like butter with a finish that’s insanely smooth. Overall VERY pleased.
customer_reviews.author: David Fowler

customer_reviews.title: The one to get, at $350 you can not beat it!
customer_reviews.text: I have it set up on the portable dewalt stand and LOVE the combo! Amazing saw Haven't used it heavily yet give me a couple weeks and I will update if I have problems but So far I am wowed. Huge upgrade from our crappy ryobi. Saw is very quiet, slides easily to angle and cuts smooth! Buy the stand It is worth it!  ***Update stand broke and is stuck in the up position. sucks. I am open to any input on how to fix this problem otherwise I'm going to have to buy a new stand :-(
customer_reviews.author: Darin

customer_reviews.title: This is dws779 type 22.  Missing a few features from the original dws779
customer_reviews.text: This is not the same as the original DWS779. It’s missing a few features like some of the reviewers mentioned. The bevel handle is make of plastic instead of metal like the one on DWS780. There is no bevel stoppers neither. Basically they moved some those features onto DWS780 and force you to pay $200+ more to get that. This one is dws779 type22. Which is not even on the Dewalt parts support website.
customer_reviews.author: YUYU LI

customer_reviews.title: Much lighter to carry around than my old one.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work as well as my old craftsman. I do think guard covering blade is not designed very strong . But, hope it last a long time. Is lighter when hauling around. Glad I stuck with the 12" blade.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Williams

customer_reviews.title: Excellent machine!!!
customer_reviews.text: it was pouring rain all day, amazon delivered on time, box was a little bit torn but machine was well packaged when i opened it everything was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Fox9

customer_reviews.title: Would highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This tool and the price is amazing. I used this for cutting siding for my house and don't know what I would have done without it. I comes with a basic construction blade. I flipped it over for cutting siding until I bought a finer tooth blade and it worked fine. I will eventually buy the work-stand for it that costs around $200 but it would defiently be helpful. I borrowed one from a friend in the meantime. If you are trying to decide between this saw or a cheaper one - definitely spring for the extra few bucks, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: BRIAN D KIBBE

customer_reviews.title: Awesome saw great price
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical about this saw, because I had heard some negative things about Dewalt, but after putting it through a workout I couldn't be happier how awsome the saw is. The sound level is extremely low, the saw is built like a tank.
customer_reviews.author: P. de Greyt

customer_reviews.title: No hiding this baby
customer_reviews.text: I Purchased this for my husband in the hopes that my craft room will get finished. ;) When purchasing for a gift note that it because it’s so big it does come in the original packaging so there’s no hiding what it is. I did get the mailman to put it in the house but did have to give it to My Husband early because it was too heavy to move.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Daus

customer_reviews.title: Does everything and great price
customer_reviews.text: High quality product from DeWalt. Does everything I need it to. Its a big mutha, no doubt. But hey, it'll cut 16" boards. Always wanted a slider, and well worth the reasonable price. Doubt waste your money on the 780...$200 more for the same exact saw with a light. Bought the light kit from M&M tools for $75. This beauty arrived in perfect shape, perfectly aligned, and quickly. Great purchase and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lee K.

customer_reviews.title: Replacing an older model
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw as a replacement for an older model Dewalt saw that had been a real work horse for me. I'm glad to see this saw seems to be of the same quality as my old saw with some upgraded features. The sliding feature really makes things easier when cutting over sized lumber... no need to flip and cut ever again. I do wish it had come with a laser guide but my old one from the former saw fit just fine. I'm back in business after just a quick glance at the excellent manual. I recommend this saw!
customer_reviews.author: rtk11226

customer_reviews.title: Best value for money.
customer_reviews.text: This saw is one of the best budget buys there is. I bought it to wok on some home projects since the price was great for what seemed to be a good product. Can confirm its a great saw at the perfect price. Probably too big for regular DIYers but definitely a great addition for those looking to do woodworking as a hobby on a budget.. updated to include that this makes installing flooring one of the easiest task ever
customer_reviews.author: Reid S

customer_reviews.title: excellent choice
customer_reviews.text: a little bit to get used to for those coming from a smaller miter saw. this saw kicks in with a jolt when first started however is smooth and steady when the blade hits the wood.
customer_reviews.author: axmsw

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, accurate
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of power for anything I've yet cut. I have little need of the side-to-side tilt, but the miter indexing is accurate. Dust collection is something of a joke. Note that there is a kick when starting the motor (not soft start), so start it with the blade at the top of its stroke. Likewise, there's a downward pull when stopping the motor, so it's best to hold it at the bottom when releasing the trigger.
customer_reviews.author: KnowledgeMerchant

customer_reviews.title: It's not a sliding Miter saw
customer_reviews.text: This came up as "Amazon recommends" for a sliding Miter saw, and also in some reveiwer lists for top sliding Miter saw. It doesn't slide, and only cuts up to 8".
customer_reviews.author: Silvia Giorgini Althoen

customer_reviews.title: Great accuracy and quality for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Have been a professional cabinet maker - now a hobby boat builder. I’ve had several chop saws over the years. I’ve been doing the finish and trim in our kitchen remodel with this new saw. The accuracy is fantastic. The prices was great. I highly recommend this saw.
customer_reviews.author: Paxman

customer_reviews.title: So many projects, so little time
customer_reviews.text: I love this saw. Cracked out two big projects the first week I bought it. It's easy to set up, easy to use. Adjustments are easy to figure out. Can't wait to make more with it. I'm primarily using it for 2x4 project construction.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bevan

customer_reviews.title: Better choice than my first marriage
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I have been shopping for a miter saw for what seems like a year. So I’ve been eyeing this one up. I looked at it maybe 20 times on Amazon. For some reason, this particular night, marked down like 300 dollars from the big box stores and it was brand new in box. The saw arrived, and I have got to tell you. Personally this is the most powerful miter I’ve ever used. It’s very impressive. Be mindful that it has a very large footprint. But if space isn’t a fact and you want to cut a 6x6, this is your saw.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bear Mobley

customer_reviews.title: DIE HARD
customer_reviews.text: This saw is replacing my previous older version that just burned out, after 27 years! Old faithfull took a beating as this saw will, so I look forward to years of reliable service. Can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: ALBERTO HERNANDEZ

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt Saw
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Help me a lot in cutting the wood for horizontal modern fence
customer_reviews.author: Your Daddy LOL

product_meta.title: DEWALT DWS780 12-Inch Double Bevel Sliding Compound Miter Saw (DWS780)
product_meta.description:
Style:Miter sawThe DEWALT 12" Double Bevel Compound Miter Saw is powered by a 15A 3,600 RPM and offers a new precise miter system and machined base fence support for optimal accuracy. Features a new handle design for maximum portability, cam lock miter, detent override, bevel crown stops and is best in class capacity. Constructed for easy, hassle free use saw's capacities are miter 0 to 60 degree left, 0 to 50 degree right, bevel 0 to 48 degree left and right, cross cuts 2 x 14 on 90 degree and miters 2 x 10 on 45 degree, base capacity 6 1/2" left and right with a crown capacity of 6 5/8". Carbide blade, dust bag, wrench and manual, 90 day money back guarantee, one year service, three year limited warranty and accessory DW7187 adjustable miter saw laser system included. Weighs 54 pounds.

AMAZON.COM
The DEWALT DWS780 12-inch double bevel sliding compound miter saw expertly walks the line between the rugged durability and fine precision that professionals need on the job site. From delicate woodworking to heavy-duty framing and deck building, the DWS780 provides the accuracy, capacity, and portability that cabinetmakers, trim carpenters, framers, installers, and contractors need.



Precise Cutting Without Recalibration
The DWS780 miter saw features extremely solid construction and the new XPS cross-cut alignment system that features an improved ultra-bright LED light, which casts a laser-like shadow on the work surface and shows the user precisely where the blade will come in contact with the material. This unique alignment system requires no recalibration over time or after changing blades, which makes it more accurate and durable than traditional laser guides.Ultimate Durability
The DWS780 miter saw’s rugged guards; precision-machined castings, fences, and bevel system; and tough stainless steel miter detent plate are designed to withstand the constant rigors of the job site.

High-Capacity Cutting
The saw features a powerful 15-amp motor that delivers 3,800 RPM. For convenience, the power cord is routed through the rail in the back, eliminating interference with the slide. Additionally, the saw offers an industry-leading combination of cut capacities, which includes 6-3/4-inch vertical capacity, 7-1/2-inch nested crown capacity, 13-7/8-inch horizontal capacity, and exclusive back fence design that cuts up to a 2x16 at a 90-degree angle and 2x12 at a 45-degree angle. To simplify and maximize vertical cutting capacity, the unit includes a rail lock latch for holding the head away from the fence.

Hassle-Free Operation
The dual bevel system is easy to see and use in job site conditions thanks to its high-visibility scale and easy angle adjustment. Bevel from zero to 49 degrees with positive stops at 0 degrees, 22.5 degrees, 33.9 degrees, 45 degrees, and 49 degrees in both right and left directions. The saw also miters 60 degrees to the right and 50 degrees to the left and features an adjustable miter detent plate with 10 positive stops. A cam lock miter button allows the user to lock angles between detents. A miter detent override is also used to allow precise angle adjustment without falling into detents.

What's in the Box
One DEWALT DWS780 12-inch double bevel sliding compound miter saw, one carbide blade, one blade wrench, one dust bag, and one vertical material clamp.





FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The DEWALT DWS780 12-inch sliding compound miter saw, has been designed to be precise and accurate enough for fine woodworking, yet durable enough for framing and deck building. The DWS780 is ideal for a variety of end users, including cabinet makers, trim carpenters, framers, installers, and many other professional contractors who require a product that delivers the accuracy, capacity, durability, portability, and ease-of-use that this saw offers. For visibility and accuracy when cutting, this saw features the XPS LED light and cut alignment system that casts a laser-like shadow on the work surface, showing users where the blade will come in contact with the material. Since it does not require recalibration over time or when changing blades, this alignment system can be more accurate and durable than traditional laser guides. The saw’s dual bevel system includes the ability to bevel right and left from 0 to 49 degrees with positive stops at 0, 22.5, 33.9, 45, and 49 degrees in both directions, as well as a high visibility bevel scale. The saw also miters 60 degrees to the right and 50 degrees to the left and features an adjustable stainless steel miter detent plate with 10 positive stops, allowing for fast and easy adjustments. A cam lock miter button allows users to lock angles between detents for versatility on the jobsite. The saw features a powerful 15 amp motor that delivers 3,800 rpm. For convenience, the power cord is routed through the rail in the back, eliminating interference with the slide. Additionally, the saw offers an industry-leading combination of cut capacities, which includes 6-3/4 inch vertical capacity, 7-1/2 inch nested crown capacity, 13-7/8 inch horizontal capacity, and exclusive back fence design that cuts up to a 2 by 16 at a 90 degree angle and 2 by 12 at a 45 degree angle. To simplify and maximize vertical cutting capacity, the unit includes a rail lock latch for holding the head away from the fence.
